text:
The character '<' will not show in the Detail pane of Chainsaw. I can see the 
character '>', but I can't see '<'.

Regards Bernd
creator: adam@rawema.de
sdeboy@iname.com
text:
Please provide more information.  I was able to load the XML content provided
with bug 29972 successfully (displayed the '<' and '>' characters).  I'm leaving
this as 'new', but it 'works for me'.  Could this be a locale issue?

I'd like to either mark 29972 as verified or reassign this bug as a duplicate of
29972.

I write the following code, e.g. log4j.info("Show me: 3 < 4 and 4 > 3 "); in my 
application.

I see in the main window, where all messages are displayed under Message: Show 
me: 3 < 4 and 4 > 3. That's ok.
But when I display the detail pane (Show detail pane) I see only Show me: 3 4 
and 4 > 3. I think, that is not ok. 
I see the same with Default Layout and TCCLayout. 
I don't think this is a locale issue, when I'm using LogFactor5 the displayed 
informations are correctly.
creator: adam@rawema.de

text:
I've been able to reproduce this problem on RedHat but it displays correctly on
Windows XP.  Adam, which OS and Java version are you using?
creator: sdeboy@iname.com
adam@rawema.de
text:
I'm using Windows XP. First Chainsaw works with Java 1.4.2. Ihen I've 
deinstalled this Java version. Now I've installed Java 1.4.2_04 and there is no 
bug in Chainsaw. It works fine and the character '<' will displayed.
